replies.msg:
Mundo Deportivo report that Barcelona are keen to get an ‘agreement in principle’ on a contract renewal for the Frenchman, and this is directly because of the Manchester United interest.

It’s been claimed in the Catalan media that Umtiti has an offer from the Premier League club of €9m per year after tax, and wants Barcelona to match this.

However, the La Liga side won’t go so high, and that’s led to some worry Manchester United could just swoop in and pay the defender’s €60m release clause.

Those representing Umtiti seem to be using the supposed interest of Jose Mourinho to force more money out of Barcelona, a similar plan to many players before him.

Umtiti was this week interviewed by French television and asked about the interest. Him not rubbishing it all has led to more worry in Catalonia.

Mundo Deportivo report that Barcelona are keen to get an ‘agreement in principle’ on a contract renewal for the Frenchman, and this is directly because of the Manchester United interest.

It’s been claimed in the Catalan media that Umtiti has an offer from the Premier League club of €9m per year after tax, and wants Barcelona to match this.

However, the La Liga side won’t go so high, and that’s led to some worry Manchester United could just swoop in and pay the defender’s €60m release clause.

Those representing Umtiti seem to be using the supposed interest of Jose Mourinho to force more money out of Barcelona, a similar plan to many players before him.

Umtiti was this week interviewed by French television and asked about the interest. Him not rubbishing it all has led to more worry in Catalonia.

replies.msg:
How's the team looking for the game tomorrow? McTominay, Romero and Young. There were issues with them [on international duty].

20:46
JM: Romero is injured. I think he will be for a few weeks. I think in the end he was lucky because it was a strong contact. It will take a bit of time to recover. Ashley Young had a problem in the last part of the game against Italy but we think there is a chance for him to recover. Daley Blind came back from his treatment in Holland and started training with us in the last few days. And he is the only one who is not available. Daley is training with us but is not available. We recovered all the other problems that we had, including Phil Jones, of course Marcos Rojo who played with Argentina. The picture has improved a lot for us in that aspect.

If Ashley Young is unavailable tomorrow would you play Luke Shaw? What's the situation there? There's been lots of talk.

20:48
JM: If he's available than Luke Shaw is always an option. Ashley Young was an option for Brighton and I started with Luke Shaw, so that's not a problem.

20:49
What was your view on the way Paul Pogba returned to the France side?

20:49
JM: I don't comment on my players' performances for their international teams.

20:50
Zlatan Ibrahimovic is going to be unveiled before the Los Angeles media today. How bigger a loss will he be in terms of influence in your dressing room and what sort of player should the Galaxy be expecting to get now?

20:54
JM: For me, it's always sad when the big players go in the direction of the end. I remember, for example, Figo's last match with me and with Inter, and I always remember it as one of my saddest moments because I always feel very, very sorry when the big ones finish, or go to the last periods of their careers. For me, the Zlatan goodbye moment was more in that direction. He's a big player that top European football is losing now, we lose forever.

I think fantastic for him, in this period, it will be very good for him. And very good for American football because of what he can do, what he can teach, what he can attract, his personality, his passion for football, his level of professionalism. I think the MLS is getting more than he is going to get. For him, it will be a way for him to enjoy the last year or couple of years of his football.
